p: The Bayesian phylogeographic analyses of HIV-1 subtype B indicated that the ancestral lineages originated in Granada. From this city, the HIV-1 subtype B epidemic in Andalusia sequentially propagated to different peripheral areas of east Andalusia, such as the coasts of El Ejido, Motril and Almería, and eventually to the landlocked area of Jaén. The most significant (Bayes Factor>3) migration routes of HIV-1 subtype B showed directionality from the inland Granada and Jaén regions to the coastal areas of El Ejido and Almería ( Fig 4).
